summary.para: The GetAllGPRMs method retrieves the current contents of all general parameter registers (GPRMs).

param.name: pRegisterArray
param.para: Pointer to an array of type GPRMARRAY that receives all 16 current GPRM values.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: GPRMs are 16-bit registers that each disc can use in unique ways for temporary data storage.

Note A player application using the DVD Navigator filter does not need to access these registers for any Annex J playback or navigation control. This method is provided for player applications implementing advanced functionality. Do not attempt to modify the GPRMs directly unless you have a thorough knowledge of the DVD specification, and the ways in which the GPRMs are used on the particular discs to be played.

summary.para: The GetAllSPRMs method retrieves the current contents of all system parameter registers (SPRMs).

param.name: pRegisterArray
param.para: Pointer to an array of type SPRMARRAY that receives the address of an array of SPRMs.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: The 24 SPRMs are used to hold information on current language, subpicture, and other navigation data.

Note A player application does not need to access these read-only registers for any standard navigation functionality. To use these registers effectively, you will probably need a more detailed knowledge of the DVD navigation commands than is provided in this documentation. The following table lists the contents of each register. Bits within the word are referred to as b0 (low order bit) through b15 (high order bit).

item.description: ISO-639 language code (two lowercase ASCII letters). Default value is undefined.
Low 4 bits (b0-b3) contain audio stream number (0 to 7) or 15 (none). Default value is 15.

Low 6 bits (b0-b5) contain subpicture stream number (0 to 31) or 62 (none) or 63 (dummy stream for forced subpicture). 7th bit (b6) contains subpicture display flag (0 = don't display subpicture). Default value is 62.
Low 4 bits (b0-b3) contain angle number (1 to 9). Default value is 1.
Low 7 bits (b0-b6) contain title number (1 to 99). Default value is 1.
Low 7 bits (b0-b6) contain title number within current VTS (1 to 99). Default value is 1.
Low 15 bits (b0-b14) contain PGC number in current title (1 to 32767). Default value is undefined.
Low 10 bits (b0-b9) contain chapter number (1 to 99). Default value is 1. Value undefined unless title is one_sequential_PGC_title.
High 6 bits (b10-b15) contain button number (1 to 36). Default value is 1024 (button 1).
Timer count, in seconds (0 to 65535). Default value is 0.
Low 15 bits (b0-b14) contain PGC number in current title (1 to 32767). Default value is undefined.

Six flags (b2: mix ch2 to ch1, b3: mix ch3 to ch1, b4: mix ch4 to ch1, b10 mix ch2 to ch0, b11: mix ch3 to ch0, b12: mix ch4 to ch0). Flag value of 0 means don't mix. Default value for all flags is 0. Value undefined if not playing Karaoke stream.
ISO-3166 country/region code (two uppercase ASCII letters) or 65535 (not specified). Default value is undefined.
Low 4 bits (b0-b3) contain parental level (1 to 8) or 15 (none). Default value is undefined.
b8-b9 contain current video output mode (0 = normal [4:3 or 16:9], 1 = panscan, 2 = letterbox). b10-b11 contain preferred display mode (0 = 4:3, 3 = 16:9). Default value is undefined.

Nine flags (b2: SDDS karaoke, b3: DTS karaoke, b4: MPEG karaoke, b6: Dolby Digital karaoke, b7: PCM karaoke, b10: SDDS playback, b11: DTS playback, b12: MPEG playback, b14: Dolby Digital playback). Flag value of 0 means incapable, 1 means capable. Default value is undefined.
ISO-639 language code (two lowercase ASCII letters) or 65535 (not specified). Default value is 65535.
Language extension code (0 = not specified, 1 = normal audio, 2 = audio for visually impaired, 3 = director comments #1, 4 = director comments #2). Default value is 0.
ISO-639 language code (two lowercase ASCII letters) or 65535 (not specified). Default value is 65535.

Language extension code (0 = not specified, 1 = normal subtitles, 2 = large subtitles, 3 = subtitles for children, 5 = normal Closed Captions, 6 = large Closed Captions, 7 = Closed Captions for children, 9 = forced subtitles, 13 = director comments, 14 = large director comments, 15 = director comments for children). Default value is 0.
Low 8 bits (b0-b7) contain region code (1 to 8).

summary.para: The GetAudioAttributes method retrieves the attributes of the specified audio stream in the current title or menu.

param.name: ulStream
param.para: Variable of type ULONG specifying the audio stream whose attributes you wish to query. See Remarks.

param.name: pATR
param.para: Pointer to a structure that is filled with the attributes of the specified audio stream.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
The stream's audio attributes are not available.

remarks.para: ulStream can be any index number from 0 through 7 or one of the following values:

item.description: DVD_DEFAULT_AUDIO_STREAM
To query for the attributes of the default audio stream.
DVD_STREAM_DATA_CURRENT
To query the current stream.
DVD_STREAM_DATA_VMGM
To query for the VMGM's audio attributes.
DVD_STREAM_DATA_VTSM
To query for the VTSM's audio attributes.

remarks.para: The use of this method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CDvdCore.GetAudioAttributes and CAudioLangDlg.GetAudioLang.

summary.para: The GetButtonAtPosition method retrieves the button located at the specified point within the display window.

param.name: point
param.para: Current mouse pointer position as retrieved through the Win32 WM_MOUSEMOVE message.

param.name: pulButtonIndex
param.para: Receives the index (from 1 through 36) of the button at the current mouse pointer position.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: This method is typically called in response to a mouse pointer move within a DVD menu display window. Be sure to check for success in the HRESULT before trying to retrieve the button number; this method only sets the value of puButtonIndex if a button is found at the specified point. DVD buttons do not necessarily have highlighted rectangles, button rectangles can overlap, and button rectangles do not always correspond to the visual representation of the buttons.

summary.para: The GetButtonRect method retrieves the rectangle coordinates for the specified menu button.
Note This method is currently not implemented.

param.name: ulButton
param.para: Specifies the menu button.

param.name: pRect
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type RECT that receives the coordinates of the button's rectangle.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: This method is currently not implemented

summary.para: The GetCmdFromEvent method retrieves an object from an EC_DVD_CMD_START or EC_DVD_CMD_END event.

param.name: lParam1
param.para: Event notification's lParam1 parameter.

param.name: pCmdObj
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface that is associated with the command that fired the event.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: This method maps the lParam1 parameter of an EC_DVD_CMD_START or EC_DVD_CMD_END event into an object that is associated with the command that fired the event. You can then call or to control the blocking behavior of the DVD Navigator with respect to that command. The IDvdCmd object is created by the DVD Navigator and the returned pointer has already had its reference count incremented, so you must release it after WaitForStart or WaitForEnd returns.

summary.para: The GetCurrentAngle method retrieves the number of available angles in the current angle block and the currently selected angle number.

param.name: pulAnglesAvailable
param.para: Receives the number of available angles. There are up to nine angles in an angle block, numbered 1 through 9. If the value equals 1, then the DVD Navigator is not in an angle block.

param.name: pulCurrentAngle
param.para: Receives the current angle number.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in a valid domain.

remarks.para: Note that angle and menu button indexes are 1-based, while audio and subpicture stream indexes are 0-based. When the DVD Navigator is about to enter an angle block, it sends the application an EC_DVD_ANGLES_AVAILABLE event notification with the lParam set to 1. Applications will typically call GetCurrentAngle and within their event handler for EC_DVD_ANGLES_AVAILABLE.
This method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CAngleDlg.MakeAngleList.

summary.para: The GetCurrentAudio method retrieves the number of available audio streams and the number of the currently selected audio stream.

param.name: pulStreamsAvailable
param.para: Receives the number of available audio streams.

param.name: pulCurrentStream
param.para: Receives the currently selected audio stream number in the current title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in a valid domain.

remarks.para: To get the available audio languages on the disc, call GetCurrentAudio and then call for each stream, starting from zero through (pulStreamsAvailable - 1) to get the language content.

summary.para: The GetCurrentButton method retrieves the number of available buttons and the number of the currently selected button.

param.name: pulButtonsAvailable
param.para: Receives the number of buttons available.

param.name: pulCurrentButton
param.para: Receives the number (from 1 through 36) of the currently selected button.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: One of the pointer arguments is not valid.

remarks.para: If buttons are not present, both pulButtonsAvailable and pulCurrentButton are set to zero.

summary.para: The GetCurrentDomain method retrieves the domain in which the DVD Navigator is currently located.

param.name: pDomain
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the current domain.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: You can use this method to test whether the DVD Navigator is finished playing in a particular title domain. An application doesn't have to test for the current domain before calling an method such as , , and so on. The DVD Navigator tests for the domain and simply does nothing, returning VFW_E_DVD_INVALIDDOMAIN, if the current command is invalid for the domain.

summary.para: The GetCurrentLocation method retrieves the current playback location.

param.name: pLocation
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the playback location information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is in an invalid domain.

remarks.para: This method retrieves information sufficient to restart playback of a video from the current playback location in titles that don't explicitly disable seeking to the current location. After the disc has been ejected, the information returned by this method will not necessarily be sufficient to restart playback. To save the current location and state information to disc so that the user can return to the same location at any later time, use .

summary.para: The GetCurrentSubpicture method retrieves the number of available subpicture streams in the current title, the currently selected subpicture stream number, and the state of the subpicture.

param.name: pulStreamsAvailable
param.para: Receives the number of available subpicture streams.

param.name: pulCurrentStream
param.para: Receives the number of the currently selected subpicture stream.

param.name: pbIsDisabled
param.para: Receives a Boolean value that indicates whether the subpicture display is disabled; TRUE means it is disabled.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in the Title domain.

remarks.para: DVD content authors can specify that any particular subpicture stream on a disc is forcedly activated, meaning that the DVD authors require this stream to display whether the viewer wants to watch it or not. The DVD Navigator complies with all such commands from the disc, meaning that forcedly activated streams are displayed even if the application has disabled subpicture display with the method.

summary.para: The GetCurrentUOPS method retrieves a set of flags indicating which navigation commands, if any, the content authors have explicitly disabled for the current disc location.

param.name: pulUOPs
param.para: Receives a bitwise values. Each bit represents the state (valid or not valid) of a user operation (UOP). If the bit is set, then that user operation is prohibited. See Remarks.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

item.description: pulUOPs is not a valid pointer.

remarks.para: DVD authors can insert UOP commands at almost any place on the disc to disallow a navigation command that would otherwise be permitted within the current DVD domain. In other words, UOP commands enable disc authors to override the usual navigation permissions.

A DVD player application should normally never have to use this method because the DVD Navigator automatically checks all UOP permissions before proceeding with any command, and will return VFW_E_DVD_OPERATION_INHIBITED from any method if the command is invalid under the current UOP. If your application needs to track the current UOP permissions itself, you can call GetCurrentUOPS whenever the current UOP permissions are required, or you can handle the EC_DVD_VALID_UOPS_CHANGE event notification in your message loop and retrieve the UOP information from the lParam1 parameter. The latter approach is generally more efficient.

summary.para: The GetCurrentVideoAttributes method retrieves the video attributes of the current title or menu.

param.name: pATR
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

remarks.para: The use of this method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CDvdCore.GetVideoAttributes().

summary.para: The GetDecoderCaps method retrieves the DVD decoder's maximum data rate for video, audio, and subpicture (in forward and reverse) as well as support for various types of audio (AC-3, MPEG-2, DTS, SDDS, LPCM).

param.name: pCaps
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the information about the decoder.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The filter graph has not been initialized.

summary.para: The GetDefaultAudioLanguage method retrieves the default audio language.

param.name: pLanguage
param.para: Receives the default language information.

param.name: pAudioExtension
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type that receives a value indicating the default DVD audio language extension.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

summary.para: The GetDefaultMenuLanguage method retrieves the default menu language.

param.name: pLanguage
param.para: Receives the language information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

summary.para: The GetDefaultSubpictureLanguage method retrieves the default subpicture language.

param.name: pLanguage
param.para: Receives the language information.

param.name: pSubpictureExtension
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type that receives one of the allowable values indicating the default language extension.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

summary.para: The GetDiscID method retrieves a system-generated 64-bit identification number for the specified DVD.

param.name: pszwPath
param.para: Path of the volume to use for the disc ID. Specify NULL to use the current or default DVD volume.

param.name: pullDiscID
param.para: Receives the 64-bit disc ID.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
The specified path is not a valid DVD disc.

remarks.para: The DVD Navigator calculates an identifier ID based on file sizes, dates, and other information, and not the BCA (burst cutting area) value. This number is guaranteed to be the same each time the disc is played. The ID applies to all replicated copies of a disc. In other words, all copies of a specific movie will have the same ID. The odds that two separate titles will have the same ID is sufficiently remote that this ID can be considered "unique" for all practical purposes.

summary.para: The GetDVDDirectory method retrieves the root directory that is set in the DVD Navigator.

param.name: pszwPath
param.para: Pointer to a buffer that receives the path string.

param.name: ulMaxSize
param.para: Size of the buffer, in WCHARs.

param.name: pulActualSize
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the size of actual data returned, in WCHARs.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The buffer is not large enough to hold the string.
The DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

remarks.para: This method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CDvdCore.GetDriveLetter.

summary.para: The GetDVDTextLanguageInfo method retrieves information about the text strings for a specified language. The method retrieves the number of strings for that language, the locale identifier, and the character set.

param.name: ulLangIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the language to query. To find the number of text-string languages on the DVD, call .

param.name: pulNumOfStrings
param.para: Receives the number of text strings for the specified language.

param.name: pLangCode
param.para: Receives a locale identifier (LCID) that specifies the language in which the text is written. For example, the LCID for "en-us" is 0x0409.

param.name: pbCharacterSet
param.para: Receives a member of the enumeration. The value specifies the character set of the text string.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: This DVD does not have any text strings, or the ulLangIndex parameter is out of bounds.

item.description: NULL pointer argument.

remarks.para: To get a particular text string, call or .

summary.para: The GetDVDTextNumberOfLanguages method retrieves the number of languages in which DVD text strings appear.

param.name: pulNumOfLangs
param.para: Receives the number of text languages.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: Depending on how the disc is authored, the number of languages will be valid either for the entire disc, or only for the current side of the disc.
If the DVD does not contain any text strings, the method succeeds, but pulNumOfLangs receives the value zero.

summary.para: The GetDVDTextStringAsNative method retrieves a DVD text string for a specified language, and returns the text string as an array of bytes.

param.name: ulLangIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the language. To find the number of text-string languages on the DVD, call .

param.name: ulStringIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the string to retrieve. To find the number of strings for a given language, call .

param.name: pbBuffer
param.para: Pointer to a buffer that receives the text string. If pchBuffer is NULL, this method returns the size of the string in pulActualSize.

param.name: ulMaxBufferSize
param.para: Size of the pchBuffer in bytes

param.name: pulActualSize
param.para: Receives the actual length of the string in bytes, including the terminating NULL.

param.name: pType
param.para: Receives a member of the enumeration. The value indicates the type of text string, such as movie title or song name. This parameter can also receive values that are not defined in the DVD_TextStringType enumeration.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: This method returns a DVD text string as a raw byte array, with no conversions. You can use this method to get text strings that are encoded using character sets other than Unicode or 7-bit ASCII (ISO/IEC 646), such as JIS Roman Kanji. To find the character set, call .
For Unicode and ASCII text strings, you can use the method, which returns a wide-character string.

The returned string always includes a single terminating NULL byte. If the buffer is smaller than the length of the DVD text string, the string is truncated. To find the required size of the buffer, call the method once with pchBuffer equal to NULL and ulMaxBufferSize equal to zero. The size is returned in pulActualSize. Then allocate a buffer and call the method again.

summary.para: The GetDVDTextStringAsUnicode method retrieves a DVD text string for a specified language, and returns the text string as a Unicode string.

param.name: ulLangIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the language. To find the number of text-string languages on the DVD, call .

param.name: ulStringIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the string to retrieve. To find the number of strings for a given language, call .

param.name: pchwBuffer
param.para: Pointer to a buffer that receives the text string. If pchBuffer is NULL, this method returns the size of the string in pulActualSize.

param.name: ulMaxBufferSize
param.para: Size of the pchBuffer buffer, in WCHARs.

param.name: pulActualSize
param.para: Receives the actual length of the string in characters, including the terminating NULL.

param.name: pType
param.para: Receives a member of the enumeration. The value indicates the type of text string, such as movie title or song name. This parameter can also receive values that are not defined in the DVD_TextStringType enumeration.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: This method supports text strings that are encoded as Unicode or 7-bit ASCII (ISO/IEC 646). If the text string uses ASCII encoding, the method converts the string to a wide-character string. If the text string uses any other character set, the method returns E_FAIL. In that case, you can call to retrieve the string as a raw byte array. To find the character set, call .

The returned string always includes a terminating NULL. If the buffer is smaller than the length of the DVD text string, the string is truncated. To find the required size of the buffer, call the method once with pchBuffer equal to NULL and ulMaxBufferSize equal to zero. The size is returned in pulActualSize. Then allocate a buffer and call the method again.

summary.para: The GetDVDVolumeInfo method retrieves the current DVD volume information.

param.name: pulNumOfVolumes
param.para: Receives the number of volumes in the volume set.

param.name: pulVolume
param.para: Receives the volume number for this root directory.

param.name: pSide
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the current disc side.

param.name: pulNumOfTitles
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type ULONG that receives the number of titles available in this volume.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: Some discs can be distributed as part of multidisc set. "Volume" in this context can mean either "disc" or "disc side", depending on how the disc was authored.

summary.para: The GetKaraokeAttributes method retrieves the karaoke attributes of the specified audio stream in the current title or menu.

param.name: ulStream
param.para: Specifies the index of the audio stream whose attributes you want to query. See Remarks.

param.name: pAttributes
param.para: Pointer to a structure that is filled with the karaoke attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
The specified stream is not in karaoke format.
The DVD Navigator is not in the title domain.
The karaoke attributes for the specified stream are not available.

remarks.para: This method does not explicitly return the number of channels in the stream. You can obtain that information through a call to . This method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CKaraokeDlg.DoModal.
The ulStream parameter may be a value from 0 through 7, or one of the following:

item.description: DVD_STREAM_DATA_CURRENT (0x800)
To query the currently selected audio stream.
DVD_DEFAULT_AUDIO_STREAM
To query the default audio stream.

summary.para: The GetMenuLanguages method retrieves all the languages available for all menus on the disc.

param.name: pLanguages
param.para: Pointer to an LCID array that receives the languages returned. To retrieve only the number of languages available for menus, and not the actual languages themselves, specify NULL for pLanguages.

param.name: ulMaxLanguages
param.para: Maximum number of languages to retrieve.

param.name: pulActualLanguages
param.para: Receives the actual number of languages retrieved.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

summary.para: The GetNumberOfChapters method retrieves the number of chapters in a given title.

param.name: ulTitle
param.para: Specifies the title.

param.name: pulNumOfChapters
param.para: Receives the number of chapters for the specified title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

remarks.para: Call this method to get the number of chapters before calling , to ensure that you specify a valid chapter number.

summary.para: The GetPlayerParentalLevel method retrieves the current parental level and ISO 3166 country/region code settings for the DVD Navigator.

param.name: pulParentalLevel
param.para: Receives a value indicating the current parental level. Valid parental levels are 1 through 8 if parental management is enabled, 0xFFFFFFFF if parental management is disabled.

param.name: pbCountryCode
param.para: Address of a two-byte array that receives the current country/region code (ISO 3166 Alpha-2 Code).

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: Parental management is disabled by default in the DVD Navigator. This method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CDvdCore.GetParentalLevel.

summary.para: The GetState method retrieves a bookmark containing the disc location and DVD Navigator state information.

param.name: pStateData
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of a DvdState object allocated by the DVD Navigator.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

remarks.para: When this method is called, the DVD Navigator creates a new state object and saves the current location into it, as well as the current parental level and other state information. The DVDState object can be used to restore the DVD Navigator to the saved location at a later time through a call to . This enables viewers to stop viewing in the middle of a disc, save the location, and come back at some later time to begin viewing where they left off, with all the internal settings restored as they were before.
The DVD Navigator calls AddRef on the DvdState object before returning it to the application. The application must call Release on the object when it is finished with it.
This method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CDvdCore.RestoreBookmark.

summary.para: The GetSubpictureAttributes method retrieves the attributes of the specified subpicture stream in the specified title or menu.

param.name: ulStream
param.para: Index number, from 0 through 31, of the subpicture stream to query. See Remarks.

param.name: pATR
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the subpicture attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The subpicture has no defined attributes.

remarks.para: The index numbers 0-31 are valid only for titles. Menus have only one subpicture stream, which must be specified using one of the constants in the table below:

item.description: DVD_STREAM_DATA_CURRENT (0x800)
To query the currently selected subpicture stream.
DVD_STREAM_DATA_VMGM (0x400)
To query the subpicture attributes for the Video Manager or "Top" Menu.
DVD_STREAM_DATA_VTSM (0x401)
To query the subpicture attributes for the currently selected Video Title Set Menu.

remarks.para: This method is demonstrated in the DVDSample application in CDvdCore.GetSPAttributes() and CSPLangDlg.GetSPLang.

summary.para: The GetTitleAttributes method retrieves attributes of all video, audio, and subpicture streams for the specified title and its menus.

param.name: ulTitle
param.para: Variable of type ULONG, from 1 through 99, specifying the requested title number. Specify 0xFFFFFFFF for the current title.

param.name: pMenu
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes of the menu associated with the specified title.

param.name: pTitle
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes of the specified title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not in the title domain.
The pMenu or pTitle parameter is invalid.
DVD Navigator is not initialized or some other internal error occurred.

summary.para: The GetTitleParentalLevels method retrieves the parental levels that are defined for a particular title.

param.name: ulTitle
param.para: Title for which parental levels are requested. Specify 0xfffffff to return the parental levels for the current title.

param.name: pulParentalLevels
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type ULONG that receives a bitwise OR combination of values defined for the title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

remarks.para: A title can contain different parental levels for different sections.

summary.para: The GetTotalTitleTime method retrieves the total playback time for the current title.

param.name: pTotalTime
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the total time in hours, minutes, seconds, and frames.

param.name: ulTimeCodeFlags
param.para: Receives a value indicating the frame rate at which the disc was authored to play. Specify NULL if you don't want to receive the timecode information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not in the title domain.
The title is not a one sequential video title, so the timing information might not be continuous.

remarks.para: The total title time is the time required to play the title sequentially, not counting any stills, pauses, and so on.

This method is for use only with one sequential video titles, which are titles such as movies in which each chapter automatically branches to the next chapter so that the entire title plays continuously without stopping. Nonsequential video titles are titles whose chapters do not automatically play one after another. Because of variations in how DVD authors encode time information on nonsequential video titles, do not use this method to determine the total time for such titles.

summary.para: The GetVMGAttributes method retrieves attributes of all video, audio, and subpicture streams for the Video Manager Menu.

param.name: pATR
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

remarks.para: The Video Manager Menu is not associated with any particular title number.

summary.para: The IsAudioStreamEnabled method determines if the specified audio stream is enabled in the current title.

param.name: ulStreamNum
param.para: Audio stream number to test.

param.name: pbEnabled
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type BOOL that receives a value of TRUE if the audio stream is enabled, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

remarks.para: A DVD can have up to eight separate audio streams, although typically not all the streams will be enabled for each title. Use IsAudioStreamEnabled to determine whether a particular stream is enabled for the current title, and then call to select one of the enabled streams.

summary.para: The IsSubpictureStreamEnabled method determines if the specified subpicture stream is enabled in the current title.

param.name: ulStreamNum
param.para: Subpicture stream number to test.

param.name: pbEnabled
param.para: Pointer to a variable of type BOOL that receives a value of TRUE if the audio stream is enabled, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

remarks.para: A DVD can have up to 32 separate subpicture streams, although typically not all the streams will be enabled for each title. Use IsSubpictureStreamEnabled to determine whether a particular stream is enabled for the current title, and then call to select one of the enabled streams.

summary.para: The IDvdInfo2 interface reports attributes of a DVD disc or the current state of DVD playback and navigation. The DVD Navigator filter implements this interface. IDvdInfo2 is the companion interface to interface. IDvdInfo2 groups the DVD Navigator's "get" methods and IDvdControl2 groups the "set" methods. Together they provide DVD navigation and playback functionality beyond the DVD Annex J specification.

Note The information provided by some of these methods can also be obtained through event notifications sent from the DVD Navigator to the application's message loop. For example, to get the current DVD domain, you can call or you can handle the EC_DVD_DOMAIN_CHANGE event in your application's message loop and extract the new domain from the event's lParam1 parameter.
